Original Line: A set is a well-defined collection of objects.

Original Line: A set which does not contain any element is called empty set .
Tokens: A set which does not contain any element is called empty set .

Original Line: A set which consists of a definite number of elements is called finite set ,
Tokens: A set which consists of a definite number of elements is called finite set ,

Tokens: otherwise , the set is called infinite set .

Original Line: Two sets A and B are said to be equal if they have exactly the same elements.
Tokens: Two sets A and B are said to be equal if they have exactly the same elements .

Original Line: A set A is said to be subset of a set B, if every element of A is also an elementof B. Intervals are subsets of R.
Tokens: A set A is said to be subset of a set B , if every element of A is also an elementof B. Intervals are subsets of R .

Original Line: A power set of a set A is collection of all subsets of A. It is denoted by P(A).
Tokens: A power set of a set A is collection of all subsets of A . It is denoted by P ( A ) .
